steps.name: Home and living
steps.intro:
In this section we will ask you questions about how you manage at home.

Important advice for completing this section:
- Choose the option(s) that best describes your situation.
- Base your answers on a typical week (if you have one).
- When answering the questions, don't think about any support you have at the moment; imagine yourself alone in your home with nobody else there to help you.

fields.question: I am able to clean and maintain my home on my own and without help not causing significant pain, distress or anxiety, or endangering myself or others and not taking significantly longer than would normally be expected.
fields.id: I am able to clean and maintain my home

fields.question: I am able to manage my day to day paperwork on my own and without help not causing significant pain, distress or anxiety, or endangering myself or others and not taking significantly longer than would normally be expected.
fields.id: I am able to manage my day to day paperwork

fields.question: I am able to use the toilet on my own and without help not causing significant pain, distress or anxiety, or endangering myself or others and not taking significantly longer than would normally be expected.
fields.id: I am able to use the toilet

fields.question: I am able to wash on my own and without help not causing significant pain, distress or anxiety, or endangering myself or others and not taking significantly longer than would normally be expected.
fields.id: I am able to wash

fields.question: I am able to get dressed and undressed on my own and without help not causing significant pain, distress or anxiety, or endangering myself or others and not taking significantly longer than would normally be expected.
fields.id: I am able to get dressed and undressed

steps.name: Your finances
steps.intro:
Unlike services provided by the NHS, most adult social care services are not free of charge

This means that when Hackney Council helps you to arrange your care and support services, you will have a financial assessment to work out how much you have to pay towards the cost of your services. This is worked out using your income, benefits and any capital or savings that you have.

Once an assessment of your care needs is completed, if you are eligible you will need to complete a full financial assessment to establish your weekly charge / contribution.

The questions below are not mandatory but completing the questions will give you an indication as to whether you are likely to have to pay for some or all of any care and support you may need.

steps.name: Contingency plan
steps.intro:
An emergency 'what if?' plan is a record of what would need to happen, should you unexpectedly not be able to provide the care you usually do.

A What If Plan more than anything is peace of mind.  It is a way of having all the most important information, key contacts, needs and likes of the person you care for recorded in one place and easily accessible should you ever be unable to be there as you usually would.

steps.name: Assessment of risk
steps.intro: Add relevant information in relation to your assessment of risk, including chronology or escalation of presenting risk where relevant. Consider the type of risks that may be present, including risks to self, by others, to others, to a persons wellbeing or physical health, and so forth. Risk is dynamic and evolving and assessment of risk should be with the adult and others working to support the adults.

steps.name: Rationale for provision
steps.intro:
Provide robust clinical justification and ensure that the recommended equipment is an essential need and consider the risks, frequency of risk and their existing supports / equipment / POC that are in place.

The person's / NOK wishes will be considered but the recommendation for telecare should be made based on essential need, and in the context of other support structures / networks in situ / being put in place.  

“Peace of mind” provision should be self funded

steps.name: Responders
steps.intro:
Key safe policy:
- Keysafes provided for telecare can only be used for telecare purposes and cannot be shared with other services.
- The telecare keysafe code will not be released to anyone except the Telecare Response Service and emergency services.
- If the service is not needed in future for any reason, Hackney does not remove the keysafe (the keys will be returned)

Please advise the person / NOK to contact the telecare installer Millbrook Healthcare if no contact has been made within 2 weeks of referral:
Work Tel: 03301244487        
Mob: 07741 260746
HackneyAdmin@millbrookhealthcare.co.uk
